DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine patient preference and acceptance of tablet sodium phosphate bowel preparation in patients who had polyethylene glycol (PEG) solution for their prior colonoscopy. This study will provide answers related to the patient preferences and their acceptance of this new method of bowel preparation.
DOC.brief_title: Patient Preference With Visicol Tablet Preparation for Colonoscopy
DOC.criteria: Prior colonoscopy with PEG solution in the past one year Must be able to swallow tablets Patients below 18 years and above 100 years. Congestive heart failure Chronic renal failure Preexisting electrolyte disorder Preexisting megacolon or a motility disorder. Patients with preexisting seizure disorder. Patients scheduled for colonoscopy after 1:00 p.m. will be excluded from the study. Pregnant or lactating women
